intro: Mariscus rechingeri, commonly known as the Rechinger's mariscus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is a small, herbaceous plant with delicate, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
